paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 variant c.211G>T: p.G71W, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Two syncopal episodes, diagnosed with LQT2.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A heterozygous missense variant, KCNH2 c.211G>T: p.G71W (dbSNP: rs199473420), was identified in the index patient (II-3) and her second daughter (III-2), but not in the unaffected first daughter (III-1).

individual_records.phenotype_details: Diagnosed with LQT after a syncope.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A heterozygous missense variant, KCNH2 c.211G>T: p.G71W (dbSNP: rs199473420), was identified in the index patient (II-3) and her second daughter (III-2), but not in the unaffected first daughter (III-1).

individual_records.phenotype_details: No symptoms or diagnosis of LQT.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A heterozygous missense variant, KCNH2 c.211G>T: p.G71W (dbSNP: rs199473420), was identified in the index patient (II-3) and her second daughter (III-2), but not in the unaffected first daughter (III-1).

functional_data.summary: The variant is located in the N-terminus of the hERG channel and has been previously reported in LQT cases.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family, as it was found in affected individuals and not in the unaffected sibling.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate, based on clinical significance classification and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The variant has conflicting interpretations of pathogenicity across different databases.
key_quotes: The variant, located in the N-terminus of the hERG channel, was previously reported in LQT cases.
Though the classification of this variant differs depending on the database, pathogenic in the VarSome and of uncertain significance in the ClinVar.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant was extracted from the main text.
